trans-unit.source: Get Started with Azure Mobile Apps for Xamarin.Android apps
trans-unit.target: Get Started with Azure Mobile Apps for Xamarin.Android apps

trans-unit.source: Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Mobile Apps for Xamarin Android development
trans-unit.target: Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Mobile Apps for Xamarin Android development

trans-unit.source: Create a Xamarin.Android App
trans-unit.target: Create a Xamarin.Android App

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to a Xamarin.Android app using an Azure Mobile App backend.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to a Xamarin.Android app using an Azure Mobile App backend.

trans-unit.source: You will create both a new Mobile App backend and a simple _Todo list_ Xamarin.Andorid app that stores app data in Azure.
trans-unit.target: You will create both a new Mobile App backend and a simple _Todo list_ Xamarin.Andorid app that stores app data in Azure.

trans-unit.source: A screenshot from the completed app is below:
trans-unit.target: A screenshot from the completed app is below:

trans-unit.source: Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Mobile Apps tutorials for Xamarin.Android apps.
trans-unit.target: Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Mobile Apps tutorials for Xamarin.Android apps.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you need the following:
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you need the following:

trans-unit.source: An active Azure account.
trans-unit.target: An active Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can sign up for an Azure trial and get up to 10 free Mobile Apps that you can keep using even after your trial ends.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can sign up for an Azure trial and get up to 10 free Mobile Apps that you can keep using even after your trial ends.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).

trans-unit.source: [Visual Studio Community 2013] or later.
trans-unit.target: [Visual Studio Community 2013] or later.

trans-unit.source: If you install Visual Studio Community 2013, install [Xamarin] separately.
trans-unit.target: If you install Visual Studio Community 2013, install [Xamarin] separately.

trans-unit.source: You can install the Xamarin tools when you install Visual Studio 2015.
trans-unit.target: You can install the Xamarin tools when you install Visual Studio 2015.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751&appServiceName=mobile), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter Mobile App in App Service.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751&appServiceName=mobile), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter Mobile App in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required; no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required; no commitments.

trans-unit.source: Create a new Azure Mobile App backend
trans-unit.target: Create a new Azure Mobile App backend

trans-unit.source: Download the server project
trans-unit.target: Download the server project

trans-unit.source: On your PC, visit the [Azure Portal].
trans-unit.target: On your PC, visit the [Azure Portal].

trans-unit.source: Click **Browse All** > **Mobile Apps**, then click the Mobile App backend that you just created.
trans-unit.target: Click **Browse All** > **Mobile Apps**, then click the Mobile App backend that you just created.

trans-unit.source: In the Mobile App blade, click **Settings** and under **Mobile App** click **Quickstart** > **Xamarin.Android**.
trans-unit.target: In the Mobile App blade, click **Settings** and under **Mobile App** click **Quickstart** > **Xamarin.Android**.

trans-unit.source: Under **Download and run your server project**, click **Download**.
trans-unit.target: Under **Download and run your server project**, click **Download**.

trans-unit.source: Extract the compressed project files to your PC, and open the solution in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Extract the compressed project files to your PC, and open the solution in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Test your backend project locally
trans-unit.target: Test your backend project locally

trans-unit.source: Publish server project to Azure
trans-unit.target: Publish server project to Azure

trans-unit.source: Download and run the Xamarin.Android app
trans-unit.target: Download and run the Xamarin.Android app

trans-unit.source: Under **Download and run your Xamarin.Android project**, click the **Download** button.
trans-unit.target: Under **Download and run your Xamarin.Android project**, click the **Download** button.

trans-unit.source: This downloads a project that contains a client application that is connected to your mobile app.
trans-unit.target: This downloads a project that contains a client application that is connected to your mobile app.

trans-unit.source: Save the compressed project file to your local computer, and make a note of where you save it.
trans-unit.target: Save the compressed project file to your local computer, and make a note of where you save it.

trans-unit.source: Press the **F5** key to build the project and start the app.
trans-unit.target: Press the **F5** key to build the project and start the app.

trans-unit.source: In the app, type meaningful text, such as _Complete the tutorial_ and then click the **Add** button.
trans-unit.target: In the app, type meaningful text, such as _Complete the tutorial_ and then click the **Add** button.

trans-unit.source: This sends a POST request to the new mobile app backend hosted in Azure.
trans-unit.target: This sends a POST request to the new mobile app backend hosted in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Data from the request is inserted into the TodoItem table.
trans-unit.target: Data from the request is inserted into the TodoItem table.

trans-unit.source: Items stored in the table are returned by the mobile app backend, and the data appears in the list.
trans-unit.target: Items stored in the table are returned by the mobile app backend, and the data appears in the list.

trans-unit.source: You can review the code that accesses your mobile app backend to query and insert data, which is found in the ToDoActivity.cs C# file.
trans-unit.target: You can review the code that accesses your mobile app backend to query and insert data, which is found in the ToDoActivity.cs C# file.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.target: [Add authentication to your app ](app-service-mobile-dotnet-backend-xamarin-android-get-started-users-preview.md)

trans-unit.source: Learn how to authenticate users of your app with an identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to authenticate users of your app with an identity provider.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
